discussion.content: I understand this, but I dislike this answer, it implies that SmartCapture is the only way to get data into a DE from some webpage, which is obviously false.

choices.D: Send email activity which contains a link to subscription center
choices.A: Data extension with opt in status

questions.question_text:
Customer Event gathers data through a tablet-based webform as part of a raffle into a data extension. Winner is randomly selected. After the event, an email should be sent to the participants to gather opt ins for marketing emails.
Define two things necessary. (Choose two.)
questions.answer_description: Smart capture works with DE and Web collect works in List.

discussion.content: All responses with Tracking Extract are wrong imo because of this: "Output files must meet the specific requirements for the data warehouse" ... you can't control the number and type of columns in those files.
For me it's C, I can manage the structure of the file with a Data Extract Activity of the Data Extension. Not that option available with tracking extract.

choices.C: SQL Query Activity to pull data view information > Data Extract Activity of data extension > File Transfer Activity
choices.A: Report activity that generates Recent Send Summary report > Report delivered directly to SFTP
choices.B: Data Extract activity of Tracking Extracts that combines data into required file > File Transfer Activity
choices.D: Data Extract Activity of data view tables > SQL Query Activity to create the required file > File Transfer Activity

questions.question_text:
The customer has the following requirements for storing engagement data in their data warehouse:
✑ All email open and click activity must be pulled daily from Marketing Cloud.
✑ Output files must meet the specific requirements for the data warehouse.
✑ All the activity must be provided via SFTP in one file.
Which automation workflow meets the customer requirements?

A customer is collecting data from a Smart Capture form that stores submissions in a data extension. The customer wants an email was sent to the marketing manager each morning that contains the previous days submissions as a CSV attachment. Assuming that the customer has the attachments feature enabled.
Which automation workflow will accomplish this?
questions.answer_description: First Query and then data extract. Since Time is fixed so Scheduled Automation.

choices.C: Scheduled Automation: SQL Query > Data Extract > Transfer File > Send Email
choices.A: Scheduled Automation: Data Extract > SQL Query > Transfer File > Send Email
choices.B: Triggered Automation: SQL Query > Data Extract > Transfer File > Send Email
choices.D: Triggered Automation: Data Extract > SQL Query > Transfer File > Send Email

discussion.content: I had a hard time understanding why a SQL activity was necessary. Now I realize that the DE from the smart capture have all historic submission data. In order to send the records that submitted from the previous day, you have to SQL query the smart capture DE and extract the resulting DE. This makes absolute sense now.

comments.content: RMM has rules in place for non-standard replies. That's why C is so important.

discussion.content: I'd say A, D, E - especially E.

choices.E: The subscriber's request contained one of the standard terms that qualify for automatic unsubscribe.
choices.B: The RMM setting 'Delete auto-replies and out-of-office replies' is set to NO.
choices.C: An email address was provided as the Routing Address for Remaining Replies.
choices.D: The RMM setting 'Unsubscribe Manual Requests' is set to YES.
choices.A: Reply Mail Management (RMM) is configured for the customer's account.

questions.question_text:
A subscriber asked to be removed from a customer's email list multiple times by replying directly to the customer's marketing message, but continues to receive emails.
Which three settings should be confirmed? (Choose three.)

choices.A: A form hosted on the company website that fires the entry event via SOAP API.
choices.B: A form hosted on the company website that fires the entry event via REST API.
choices.D: A SmartCapture form hosted in CloudPage that populates the entry source.
choices.C: A SmartCapture form hosted in CloudPages that updates a Profile attribute.

questions.question_text:
A company is hosting a series of events and wants its customers who register to enter into a journey.
Which two methods are viable configurations for entry? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The SOAP API exposes functions or operations, while REST APIs are data-driven. SOAP APIs are rigid and only allow XML messaging between applications.
